title: Patient areas wired as cardiac-protected or body-protected electrical areas
fullText:
In Australia, an area shall have a current sticker attached to the area sign before repairs proceed.
The following work may be carried out within a patient area using methods that were acceptable when that part of the electrical installation was originally installed, provided the methods satisfy the fundamental safety principles of Part 1 of AS/NZS 3000:
(a)	Repair to, or replacement of, accessories (as defined in AS/NZS 3000) forming part of the existing electrical installation, or replacement of such accessories with equivalent fittings.
(b)	Replacement of component parts of fixed equipment with equivalent components.
Replacement of an item of fixed electrical equipment in a patient area constitutes an alteration to the electrical installation and shall be in accordance with Clause 6.2.
The replaced items shall be tested against the applicable conformance requirement(s) of this Standard. The results should be documented and made available.
